page.title: 09local history
page.content: The largest & most splendid house is Barrington Court & it was built in the 16th.century.In the 20th. century it was leased by Colonel Lyle from the National Trust. The foundations of St.Mary's Church were laid in the 13th.century.The church is built of hamstone.The octagonal tower (one of only 12 in Somerset) was increased in height in the 15th. century.Glebe House,once the vicarage,was built in 1710.The Priory is very old but the name dates only from the 19th.century when the name was sometimes given to a farmhouse. Stocklinch has 2 medieval churches (one only used in summer).Puckington has a medieval church as well.
